title: Learning from COVID-19 to unlock more value from energy storage
lead: Wärtsilä Energy's vice president for Africa & Europe Björn Ullbro takes a look at the lessons learnt from COVID-19 by the storage sector, and what more can be done in the coming year.
author: Björn Ullbro

title: npower shuts app following hack of customers' accounts
lead: ​UK energy supplier npower’s app has been hacked, and customers' accounts accessed including partial bank details.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Electricity North West calls for feedback as it prepares network for 3m EVs by 2050
lead: ​Distribution network operator Electricity North West has outlined how it will support the more than 3 million electric vehicles (EVs) predicted to be use in its region by 2050.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Roaming service covering 68% of UK chargepoints launches for Kia EV customers
lead: ​Kia has launched KiaCharge, giving owners of Kia battery electric vehicles (BEVs) and plug-in hybrid vehicles (PHEV) access to over 13,900 chargers across the UK from a single account.
author: Alice Grundy

title: People's Energy calls on Chancellor to provide support for domestic renewables initiatives
lead: ​People’s Energy is calling on Chancellor Rishi Sunak to deliver further support for renewable energy programmes in next week’s Budget.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Centrica sees record profit drop of 31% in 2020
lead: ​British Gas owner Centrica saw its adjusted operating profit fall 31% in 2020, a record low according to its preliminary results.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Cornwall Insight charts REGO demand increase as prices begin recovery
lead: ​Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin (REGOs) have started to recover following the impact of COVID-19, according to Cornwall Insight.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Iberdrola lauds record investment as net profit continues growth
lead: ​Iberdrola has reported continued growth of its net profit to €3.61 billion in a year that saw over 90% of its investments injected into renewables and networks.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Implementation of Grid-Enhancing Technology could double renewables integration by 2025
lead: ​Double the renewables currently waiting in connection queues could be integrated into the grid using Grid-Enhancing Technologies (GETs), a new study has found.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Drax drops plan for Europe’s largest new gas plant as it turns its back on fossil fuels
lead: ​Drax has dropped plans to develop any new gas plants, including its plans to build Europe's biggest CCGT plant as it moves to turn its back on fossil fuels.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Smart meter installations fall 40% year-on-year in January 2021
lead: The installation of smart meters fell 40% year-on-year in January, as the enduring impact of the COVID-19 lockdown continues to be felt.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SP Energy Networks: World-first re-energising project is just the beginning
lead: SP Energy Networks’ director of Network Planning & Regulation Scott Mathieson takes a look at the  world-first renewable blackstart projects the DNO is currently working on.
author: Scott Mathieson

title: REA details pathway to net zero and economic recovery in new green strategy
lead: A green pathway detailing measures needed to deliver net zero – focusing largely on renewables targets – has been published by the Association for Renewable Energy and Clean Technology (REA).
author: Alice Grundy

title: BNEF: At least $14tn must be spent on power grids worldwide or risk ‘bottleneck’
lead: ​At least $14 trillion (£9 trillion) must be invested in the grid worldwide by 2050 to support an evolved power system, according to new analysis from BloombergNEF (BNEF).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Government EV consultation welcomed as charging networks stress 'vital' need for interoperability leadership
lead: ​The government’s consultation into public electric vehicle (EV) charging has been largely praised by EV charging networks, although thought must be given to costs and complexity.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SMS commits to carbon neutrality by 2030, targeting renewables and EVs
lead: ​Smart meter company SMS will adopt on-site renewable generation and battery storage, as it works towards its 2030 net zero carbon target.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Eelpower selects EDF to optimise 80MW of battery storage
lead: ​Energy storage operator Eelpower has selected EDF as a trading and optimising partner for three of its batteries.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Origami enters Gore Street’s Port of Tilbury into Dynamic Containment pushing capacity over 400MW
lead: ​Optimiser Origami has entered Gore Street Energy Storage Fund’s 9MW Port of Tilbury battery into Dynamic Containment (DC) services.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Heat Pump Federation calls for "consistency of policy" amidst reports of early Green Homes Grant closure
lead: ​The Heat Pump Federation is urging for “consistency of policy” as the impact on installers is highlighted.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Flexibility and the ENA: Farina Farrier takes a look at the Open Networks project
lead: ENA’s head of Open Networks Farina Farrier explores how the association is driving forward change that will improve transparency, boost new flexibility markets, and secure the supply of clean, low-carbon energy.
author: Farina Farrier
